ur_rna.Utilities

Class MathUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • ur_rna.Utilities.MathUtil

  • public class MathUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Extended math functions.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MathUtil()

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Returns the base 2 logarithm of a number.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MathUtil

        public MathUtil()

    • Method Detail

      • log2

        public static double log2(double value)
        Returns the base 2 logarithm of a number. i.e. log(value)/log(2)

      • log2i

        public static int log2i(double value)
        Returns the smallest integer x such that 2^x is greater than or equal to the specified value. e.g. Pow2(37) returns 6 (because 2^6 is the smallest power of two greater than or equal to 37)
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:
        An integer that represents the exponent of the smallest power of two that is greater than or equal to the specified value.

      • pow2

        public static double pow2(double value)
        Returns the smallest power of 2 greater than or equal to the specified value. e.g. Pow2(37) returns 64 because 32 < 37 <= 64

      • pow2i

        public static int pow2i(double value)
        Returns the smallest power of 2 greater than or equal to the specified value. e.g. Pow2(37) returns 64, which is the smallest power of 2 greater than or equal to 37. Note: If the return value might exceed the range of an integer, then pow2L(double) or pow2(double) should be used instead.

      • pow2L

        public static long pow2L(double value)
        Returns the smallest power of 2 greater than or equal to the specified value. e.g. Pow2(37) returns 64, which is the smallest power of 2 greater than or equal to 37.
